content.html_value:
The Origin of Matter

The science of Chemistry, like Physics (History Tracers Editors. Physics), goes beyond the limits of planet Earth. When studying the birth of galaxies, for example, we can identify chemical elements that are essential for life (Gibson, Carl H., et al., , pp. 10).

Like any science, Chemistry is also directly connected to the language of mathematics. For this reason, we begin this section with Chapter 6 of the First Steps, which is dedicated to the study of mathematics in connection with other sciences. Thus, we recommend reading the first five chapters of that part before continuing (History Tracers Editors. First Steps).
Chapter 1: The Origin of What We Observe

value.name: Shared Origin
value.desc: In this text, we take a journey back in time to understand what current measurements reveal about the universeâ€™s past.

value.name: Simplicity vs. Complexity
value.desc: Despite more than 13.8 billion years of evolution of the universe, we often still wish to be like it was in its beginnings. Why?
